etymology.description: 思(思) (sī, "to think") + 想(想) (xiǎng, "to ponder") combine to convey the concept of thought or thinking.
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 思(思) (sī, "to think") and 想(想) (xiǎng, "to ponder") highlights the process of intellectual reflection and consideration, capturing the essence of both conscious and unconscious thoughts.

examples.chinese: 他的思想深邃(他的思想深邃)。
艺术启迪思想(藝術啟迪思想)，梦想照亮前行(夢想照亮前行)。
examples.pinyin: Yìshù qǐdí sīxiǎng, mèngxiǎng zhàoliàng qiánxíng.
examples.english: Art inspires thought, and dreams illuminate the way forward.
